connector.description: Receive events from AWS DynamoDB Streams.

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.tab.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.table
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.tab.description: Name of the DynamoDB table to look at

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.acc.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.acc.description: The access key obtained from AWS

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.sec.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.sec.description: The secret key obtained from AWS

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.reg.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.region
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.reg.description: The AWS region to connect to Example: eu-west-1

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.ite.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.iteratorType
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.ite.description: Defines where in the DynaboDB stream to start getting records. Note that using TRIM_HORIZON can cause a significant delay before the stream has caught up to real-time. if {AT,AFTER}_SEQUENCE_NUMBER are used, then a sequenceNumberProvider MUST be supplied. There are 4 enums and the value can be one of TRIM_HORIZON, LATEST, AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER, AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.seq.name: camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.sequenceNumberProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-ddb-streams-source.seq.description: Provider for the sequence number when using one of the two ShardIteratorType AT_SEQUENCE_NUMBER or AFTER_SEQUENCE_NUMBER iterator types. Can be a registry reference or a literal sequence number. Example: 900000000005745712447
